conclusion: Analyze the circuit to determine equivalent resistance and use it to find charge on capacitor.
Circuit with power supply, capacitor, and three resistors labeled R1, R2, R3. Power supply has electromotive force E and internal resistance r. Switch S is closed, circuit is stable.
Circuit consists of power supply with E = 6V, internal resistance r = 2Ω, capacitor C = 10μF, resistors R1 = 2Ω, R2 = 3Ω, R3 = 6Ω.
Resistors R1, R2, R3 are in series, total resistance R_total = R1 + R2 + R3 = 11Ω.
Circuit is stable, current I through circuit is constant.
Charge Q on capacitor can be found using formula Q = E/r × C.
Substitute values: E = 6V, r = 2Ω, C = 10μF = 10 × 10^-6 F.
